Class SD

    • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.SD

extends Object
    SPARQL 1.1 Service Description vocabulary class.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    SPARQL 1.1 Service Description , https://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/bigdata/ticket/500

      • resultFormat

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI resultFormat
        Relates an instance of Service to a format that is supported for serializing query results. URIs for commonly used serialization formats are defined by Unique URIs for File Formats. For formats that do not have an existing URI, the media_type and preferred_suffix properties defined in that document SHOULD be used to describe the format.
        See Also:
        Unique URIs for File Formats

      • inputFormat

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI inputFormat
        Relates an instance of sd:Service to a format that is supported for parsing RDF input; for example, via a SPARQL 1.1 Update LOAD statement, or when URIs are dereferenced in FROM/FROM NAMED/USING/USING NAMED clauses (see also sd:DereferencesURIs below).

        URIs for commonly used serialization formats are defined by Unique URIs for File Formats. For formats that do not have an existing URI, the media_type and preferred_suffix properties defined in that document SHOULD be used to describe the format.

        See Also:
        Unique URIs for File Formats

      • HighlyAvailable

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI HighlyAvailable
        A highly available deployment - this feature refers to the presence of the HAGlue interface, the capability for online backups, and the existence of a targer ReplicationFactor. You must consult the target ReplicationFactor in order to determine whether the database is in principle capable of tolerating one or more failures and the actual #of running joined instances to determine whether the database can withstand a failure.

      • ReplicationFactor

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI ReplicationFactor
        The value of this feature is the target replication factor for the database expressed as an xsd:int. If this is ONE (1), then the database is setup with a quorum and has the capability for online backup, but it is not replicated. TWO (2) indicates mirroring, but is not highly available. THREE (3) is the minimum configuration that can withstand a failure.

      • ScaleOut

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI ScaleOut
        An IBigdataFederation.

      • MapgraphCompatible

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI MapgraphCompatible
        This indicates that the namespace is compatible with mapgraph (aka GPU) acceleration, but this does not indicate whether or not the namespace is currently loaded in the mapgraph-runtime.

      • MapgraphAcceleration

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI MapgraphAcceleration
        This indicates that the namespace is currently loaded within the mapgraph-runtime.

      • KB_NAMESPACE

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI KB_NAMESPACE

      • defaultEntailmentRegime

        public static final org.openrdf.model.URI defaultEntailmentRegime
         http://www.w3.org/ns/entailment/OWL-RDF-Based
 http://www.w3.org/ns/entailment/RDFS
 http://www.w3.org/ns/owl-profile/RL
        See Also:
        Unique URIs for Semantic Web Entailment Regimes [ENTAILMENT] (members of the class sd:EntailmentRegime usable with the properties sd:defaultEntailmentRegime and sd:entailmentRegime) , Unique URIs for OWL 2 Profiles [OWL2PROF] (members of the class sd:EntailmentProfile usable with the properties sd:defaultSupportedEntailmentProfile and sd:supportedEntailmentProfile)

      • SD

        public SD(org.openrdf.model.Graph g,
          AbstractTripleStore tripleStore,
          String... serviceURI)
        Parameters:
        g - Where to assemble the description.
        tripleStore - The KB instance to be described.
        serviceURIs - One or more service end points for that KB instance.
        See Also:
        #describeService()

    • Method Detail

      • describeService

        public void describeService(boolean describeStatistics,
                            boolean describeNamedGraphs)
        Collect various information, building up a service description graph.
        Parameters:
        describeStatistics - When true, the VoID description will include the VoidVocabularyDecl.vocabulary declarations, the property partition statistics, and the class partition statistics.
        describeNamedGraphs - When true and the KB instance is in the quads mode, each named graph will also be described in in the same level of detail as the default graph. Otherwise only the default graph will be described.

      • describeServiceEndpoints

      • describeResultFormats

        Describe the supported result formats.
        See Also:
        resultFormat

      • describeOtherFeatures

        protected void describeOtherFeatures()
        Describe non-language features.

        Note: Do NOT report the backing store type (Journal, TemporaryStore, Federation), the journal buffer mode, etc. here. That is all back end stuff and should be visible through an API which can be separately secured. The ServiceDescription is supposed to be "web" facing so it should not have that low level stuff. TODO sd:languageExtension or sd:feature could be used for query hints, NAMED SUBQUERY, the NSS REST API features, etc.

      • describeEntailmentRegime

        protected void describeEntailmentRegime()
        Describe the entailment regime. TODO The Axioms interface could self-report this.
